intro: Metagonia alaternoides, commonly known as the alaternoides mallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique floral structure and vibrant colors make it a notable species in its native habitat.
